#| label: implementation-timeline

import pandas as pd
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.express as px

# Timeline scenarios
scenarios = pd.DataFrame({
    'Approach': ['Legislative', 'Executive Order', 'Hybrid (EOâ†’Congress)'],
    'Time to Launch (Months)': [36, 12, 18],
    'Initial Funding': [27000, 100, 1177],
    'Success Probability': [30, 60, 75],
    'Legal Challenge Risk': [10, 80, 40]
})

# Create grouped bar chart
fig = go.Figure()

metrics = ['Time to Launch (Months)', 'Success Probability', 'Legal Challenge Risk']
colors = ['blue', 'green', 'red']

for i, metric in enumerate(metrics):
    fig.add_trace(go.Bar(
        name=metric,
        x=scenarios['Approach'],
        y=scenarios[metric],
        marker_color=colors[i]
    ))

fig.update_layout(
    title='Implementation Approach Comparison',
    xaxis_title='Implementation Approach',
    yaxis_title='Value',
    barmode='group',
    height=500,
    legend=dict(x=0.7, y=1)
)

fig.show()

print("\nRecommended Strategy: Hybrid Approach")
print("1. Launch via Executive Order (fast, demonstrates value)")
print("2. Build momentum with early wins")
print("3. Secure Congressional funding once proven")
